ARABIC: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Then if you follow me, do not question me about anything until I myself make mention of it to you.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If you must follow me," he said, "do not ask me any thing until I speak of it to you myself."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He said: "Well, if you follow me, do not ask me concerning anything until I myself mention it to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He said to Moses, "If you will follow me, do not ask me about anything until I tell you the story about it."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “Therefore if you stay with me, do not ask me about anything until I myself mention it to you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "Then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything till I myself mention of it to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: If you would follow me, then do not question me about any thing until I myself speak to you about it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said he, 'Then if thou followest me, question me not on anything until I myself introduce the mention of it to thee.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Well, if thou go with me, ask me not concerning aught till I myself make mention of it unto thee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He said, "Well then, if you would follow me, do not ask me about anything till I speak of it to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: then if thou wilt follow me ask me not of anything until begin thereof some mention.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘If you follow me, do not question me concerning anything until I myself first mention it for you.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me, ask me no questions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning it."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He (Khidr) said: "Then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything till I myself mention it to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He said: 'If you follow me, you must not question me about anything till I myself speak to you concerning it'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “If you follow me, do not ask me about anything, until I myself make mention of it to you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:70] He said, ‘If you follow me then do not question me (lā tas’alnī, a variant reading has lā tas’alannī) concerning anything, that you might find objectionable in what I do, according to your [limited] knowledge, and be patient, until I [myself] make mention of it to you’, in other words, [until] I mention it to you with [an explication of] the reason for it. Moses accepted his precondition bearing in mind the respect which a student should exercise in the presence of a teacher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Khidr said: (Well, if thou go with me) if you keep my company, Moses, (ask me not concerning aught) about what I do (till I myself mention of it unto you) until I proceed to explain it to you.
